page.title: 14CYCLE TRACK STROUD
page.content: { WOODCHESTER RAILWAY RE-USED Since 1982,Stroud has been building a cycle track along the course of the old Midland Railway branch line from Nailsworth to Stroud and onto Stonehouse.Cyclists like it because it follows the valley bottom. So far 7 miles of track have been completed despite many difficulties and the final 3 miles to Nailsworth will be completed by the end of 1985. The venture started as the result of a competition run by local Quakers looking for suggestions on how to lower local unemployment and to help the local community.A cycle track was one of the winning entries.The government has provided a grant for the scheme. The track has proved popular with pedestrians and cyclists and safe.An adjacent BMX track is very popular.
